original_solution_mapping.L1: Sam completes a widget every 10 minutes.
original_solution_mapping.L2: When Jack helps they finish 2 in 15 minutes. Sam has finished 1 widget and has begun working on another one, and Jack finishes the second one at 15 minutes. So it takes Jack 15 minutes to complete a widget.
original_solution_mapping.L3: Sam worked for 6 hours yesterday, so he was able to complete 6 hours * 60 minutes per hour / 10 minutes per widget = <<6*60/10=36>>36 widgets.
original_solution_mapping.L4: Jack worked for 4 hours, so he was able to complete 4 hours * 60 minutes per hour / 15 minutes per widget = <<4*60/15=16>>16 widgets.
original_solution_mapping.L5: Sam, Jack, and Tony were able to complete 68 widgets together. So of those, Tony personally completed 68 widgets - 36 widgets - 16 widgets = <<68-36-16=16>>16 widgets.
original_solution_mapping.L6: It took Tony 8 hours to complete those 16 widgets, so he takes 8 hours * 60 minutes per hour / 16 widgets = <<8*60/16=30>>30 minutes per widget.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 399.
    Returns: the time it takes Tony to assemble a Widget in minutes.
    """
    # L1
    sam_time_per_widget = 10 # He can assemble 1 widget every 10 minutes.

    # L2
    jack_time_per_widget = 15 # So it takes Jack 15 minutes to complete a widget.

    # L3
    sam_hours_worked = 6 # Sam worked for 6 hours
    minutes_per_hour = 60 # WK
    sam_widgets_completed = sam_hours_worked * minutes_per_hour / sam_time_per_widget

    # L4
    jack_hours_worked = 4 # Jack was able to help out for 4 hours
    jack_widgets_completed = jack_hours_worked * minutes_per_hour / jack_time_per_widget

    # L5
    total_widgets_completed = 68 # At the end of the day, they had completed 68 widgets.
    tony_widgets_completed = total_widgets_completed - sam_widgets_completed - jack_widgets_completed

    # L6
    tony_hours_worked = 8 # Tony worked the entire 8-hour shift.
    tony_time_per_widget = tony_hours_worked * minutes_per_hour / tony_widgets_completed

    # FA
    answer = tony_time_per_widget
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: Sam worked for {sam_hours_worked} hours yesterday, so he was able to complete {sam_hours_worked} hours * {minutes_per_hour} minutes per hour / {sam_time_per_widget} minutes per widget = <<{sam_hours_worked}*{minutes_per_hour}/{sam_time_per_widget}={sam_widgets_completed}>>{sam_widgets_completed} widgets.

Jack worked for {jack_hours_worked} hours, so he was able to complete {jack_hours_worked} hours * {minutes_per_hour} minutes per hour / {jack_time_per_widget} minutes per widget = <<{jack_hours_worked}*{minutes_per_hour}/{jack_time_per_widget}={jack_widgets_completed}>>{jack_widgets_completed} widgets.

Sam, Jack, and Tony were able to complete {total_widgets_completed} widgets together. So of those, Tony personally completed {total_widgets_completed} widgets - {sam_widgets_completed} widgets - {jack_widgets_completed} widgets = <<{total_widgets_completed}-{sam_widgets_completed}-{jack_widgets_completed}={tony_widgets_completed}>>{tony_widgets_completed} widgets.

It took Tony {tony_hours_worked} hours to complete those {tony_widgets_completed} widgets, so he takes {tony_hours_worked} hours * {minutes_per_hour} minutes per hour / {tony_widgets_completed} widgets = <<{tony_hours_worked}*{minutes_per_hour}/{tony_widgets_completed}={tony_time_per_widget}>>{tony_time_per_widget} minutes per widget.

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L3: Sam worked for 6 hours yesterday, so he was able to complete 6 hours * 60 minutes per hour / 10 minutes per widget = <<6*60/10=36>>36 widgets.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L4: Jack worked for 4 hours, so he was able to complete 4 hours * 60 minutes per hour / 15 minutes per widget = <<4*60/15=16>>16 widgets.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L5: Sam, Jack, and Tony were able to complete 68 widgets together. So of those, Tony personally completed 68 widgets - 36 widgets - 16 widgets = <<68-36-16=16>>16 widgets.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L6: It took Tony 8 hours to complete those 16 widgets, so he takes 8 hours * 4 minutes per hour / 16 widgets = <<8*4/16=2>>2 minutes per widget.

explanation: Input misrepresentation. The value for 'jack_hours_worked' (4) was used instead of 'minutes_per_hour' (60).
